page.title: 04MR. GEORGE WILLIAMS
page.content: Interview with Mr.George Williams. He has lived in Trefnant all his life, when he was a boy, there used to be one big food shop, a grocer shop, a paper shop, a post office, a public house, a shoe shop and a butchers shop. He says the village has trebled in size from when he was small. He is a farmer and deals in livestock, sheep ,pigs and cows. He is an agent for butchers all over the country, Manchester, Wolverhampton and Glasgow. He used to run a butchers shop his father had left him but he gave that up to do farming. The butchers had been in the family since 1900. The village is happy and very close-nit, there are a lot of old English people who have come to retire in the area and the villages have no objections. Trefnant has won the competition for the best kept village
